item.title: Attaching a file in Cordova & uploading it with jQuery Mobile
item.description: This post is for those unlucky souls who are tasked with developing an Android solution that attaches a file to an HTML form using Cordova and uploads the form via jQuery Mobile. Documentation on these topics is scarce so I’ve created a minimal example on my GitHub page demonstrating how to do this. Instructions to run the example are found inside the project’s README file.

item.title: A WebSocket Cordova plugin for Android
item.description: This week I’ve investigated the feasibility of leveraging NullMQ inside a Cordova/PhoneGap application on Android. NullMQ sends and receives messages via WebSocket, and unfortunately, Android’s browser doesn’t support the standard yet. I found Cordova plugins on GitHub that implement WebSocket. The problem is that none of them functioned properly against the latest version of the WebSocket spec, that is, RFC 6455. So I decided to fork the Java-WebSocket project and expose it as a Cordova plugin.
